Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay; a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: getpaul
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property the last weekend of August 2012, and enjoyed the stay very much. Other reviewers have stated that the location is excellent, and it is. What that means is the hotel is right on the Branson Landing which is an outdoor mall of sorts, but also has a great assortment of upscale restaurants and nightlife as well. Waxy O'Shea's (Irish Pub) is right across the walkway and has live music many nights, as well as other type venues. However, if you are going to music shows on the strip, then many will be 15-25 minutes away due to traffic (not distance). The room we stayed in was very clean, staff was friendly as most are in Branson, and would stay here again. The room rate is higher than what you can stay on the strip (which is the only reason why I gave it 4 stars instead of 5), but you do pay for the convenience of being to walk right out of your hotel into the landing. This hotel is more for those who want to be in the middle of the action and a more urban feel. If you are looking for the mom and pop type that Branson has lots of, then this would not be it. Parking is $8 but I would advise to skip that and park for free by Belk store. You can drop you luggage while you check in, then park for free by Belk and walk down the landing back to your hotel; no big deal at all.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel! great time!”
Reviews.Author: Leslie S
Reviews.Content: It will be hard to stay anywhere else when my husband and I visit Branson in the future. The hotel staff went above and beyond taking care of our special needs. We had a junior king sweet that looked out over the fountain. It had a huge patio area and we spent several hours out there watching a concert one night and the fountain and light show. If I had one thing to complain about it, it was an issue with the shower. Don't get me wrong-the bathroom is one of the biggest hotel baths I have seen, but the shower door wasnt installed right or something because during every shower, water would go out onto the bathroom floor.

Reviews.Title: “Rip Off”
Reviews.Author: Brenda K
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel Sept 2 for one night. I had made a prior reservation through Travelocity and since the rooms were so pricey decided to book the non refundable price which I will never do again. We ended up having to change the reservation to a week ahead. Non refundable means just that and they mean it. So will never do that again. I paid for two nights and got one. Hotel offered no help just my bad luck. I understand that. Kudos best service was the parking valets. Great job Joe and the guys!! Now the good: Room was nice but not as nice as the original room I had booked which had the fountain view. Due to my need to change the reservation I had to book a cheaper room. This was a double queen without the fountain view I had wanted. Still nice room has a fridge and microwave and balcony. We could hear the band when we got back to our room until late maybe 10-11 but we were ok with that. Restaurants were close and so were the shops. Piano bar was great. Bad: We had no idea we were in the other building and I had read to valet park which we did as parking yourself is $8 and valet is $12. Had to lug our stuff over to the next building and 4th floor as no one offered to help us. When we came back in for the evening the smoke alarm went off. I called the front desk and no one answered. My husband had to deal with it. Also know that internet service is $9.95 extra and we never could get the tv to work. Pool had to be in the other building as we never saw it or looked. Too much hauling of things back and fourth. Now the trolley never came as scheduled. We walked to everything. Drinks and beer are pricey so be prepared. Bottled beer $4 in most places. Piano bar $10 to get in but if you leave you cannot get back in even though they said they had a stamp we needed to leave but guess what they had no stamp. So we just left. But the place and music were great. Due to all the walking I felt worn out and exhausted and did not enjoy the stay. Shower next morning was a joke. Shower pressure very limited. Pretty shower but that is it. I truly will not stay someplace again that is where you cannot get to your car and room easily. We have stayed in Miami and Tampa and had much nicer rooms for this price. No reasonable place for breakfast next am so it was either eat in the hotel pricey restaurant or go ahead and check out as we would have had to pay $8-12 to park when we came back for about 3 hours left in the room. So some things are limited and pricey. Now worst part since I paid for the room ahead of time I was shocked to see the $50 hold charge on my debit card. I have been though this before but forgot about it. They hold $50 until you check out but your bank can and does hold it for days. Be prepared on this one. Over all would probably not go back even though the room was nice. Just felt trapped and limited on coming and going as I pleased. For $207 which is what I paid for the first room which would have been about $250 you would think the internet would be free and service much better!

Reviews.Title: “no sleep”
Reviews.Author: jcook197
Reviews.Content: Had a room that faced the street. Every street noise could be plainly heard in the room. What was worse was that freight trains go by multiple times during the night starting at 1:30. The trains were so loud that it felt like the room was vibrating. I am a sound sleeper and this is the first room I have ever had where I couldn't sleep. I have no other complaints about the hotel, but everything else was overshadowed by the noise problem which was absolutely intolerable.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch In Branson”
Reviews.Author: underwaterman
Reviews.Content: Had a bad experience at another hotel and switched to this Hilton - turned out to be a great decision. I was upgraded to a suite in the south tower and I was very impressed when I walked into this 800 sq ft 'apartment'. It had a large full service kitchen, a living room with a balcony that could be accessed from the bedroom and living room and even had a washer and dryer that was free to use. The bathroom was massive with a glass shower and jacuzzi tub. The bed was great and the service was exceptional. Very happy to have stayed here for work. If I came back with my family I would definitely stay here again. They are just finishing a brand new Hilton across the street that isn't open yet but looks impressive. By far the nicest building Branson has ever built. The town has an older feel but that's just the family-frienly vibe this town offer. Either way, this Hilton is the way to go for comfort. It's also located smack in the middle of all the shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: kslady56
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights Aug 7th-8th. We had a Jr. Suite. Room was very nice and clean. A Jr. Suite has a seperate bedroom, kitchen/living room and a large bathroom. We also had a balcony. It was all very nice. The only thing was we were in the South bldg. so we had to go out of the main bldg and walk across to another building to our room. There was no restaurant in this building. You can get room service. Our room was on the 5th floor across from other buildings. We couldn't see the fountains froms our room which is a disappointment but my husband didn't know you could request that type of room. Bed was very comfortable. They were working on the building across the walk from us, I guess probably the apartments. They were quite noisy at 7:00am in the morning which we didn't like since we were trying to get away for some much needed rest. They were using a lift to get up on the building to paint. Overall we would stay here again. It is a nice location if you are going to stay for a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but must pay for the basic extras”
Reviews.Author: NorthTexan_9
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed for several days at this hotel. While the location is great on the Landing with the restaurants and shopping right there, many of the basic extras require an additional fee and the room rates are not cheap compared to other hotels in the Branson area. Granted you are basically paying for the location, but the additional fee for Internet use in your room (unless you are at one of the upper levels of the Hilton Honors), the high priced breakfast (which is usually free at most hotels we stay at) plus the cost to park your car. Branson is not a big city so having to incur these extra costs that are normally provided at no charge even in most big city hotels, was somewhat disappointing. We did enjoy our visit to Branson and found this hotel to be nicely decorated. We did have a small issue when we arrived. The front desk staff wrote the wrong room number on our room key holder and so we could not get into the room we thought that was ours. Finally, with all of our bags in tow since we received no help from the bellhops downstairs, a staff member happened to be walking by and we told him our issue and showed him the number written on our card holder. He called the front desk after using his key to open the door which was already occupied by another family. When we got into our room, we found it be of decent size for a family of four. The bathroom was big and was very appealing with both a tub and separate glass shower. We had a small fridge in the room which came in handy as well. We did not have a fountain view (which we probably could not afford with all of the extra charges anyway), but we did enjoy our stay. We also used the pool which stayed open until11:00p.m. which was convenient after returning from an evening show. Overall we found most of the staff to be friendly but could tell that some others were not as welcoming as would be expected from vacationers. The bored look on their face when you walked by or their body language often showed that a few of the staff seemed unhappy or were having a bad day, but it was noticeable at times. Others smiled and acted happy whether they were or not but that goes a long way with pleasing a traveler. We enjoyed Branson and would consider staying here again on our next visit if the rate was right.

Reviews.Title: “Great room”
Reviews.Author: SuzyQ50
Reviews.Content: The room was great. Mother was given a night for her retirement and my sister & I took her. When calling for reservations 1st person I spoke with could not understand her and she told us no rooms and was rude. We called back and spoke with a younger woman who gladly accommodated us giving us an upgrade to view of fountains. I have to agree with a review about the AC during the night could never get it regulated. We were in the south tower, our room was off a hall with a washer/dryer & another room, they were extremely loud. Our room was never cleaned on our stay, they came the 1st morning and we told them we were leaving to shop in 15 minutes and they said would come back!!! When we returned from outing room not cleaned and had a VERY strong smoke odor!! Called desk they brought towels and to spray room freshner. He had to come twice! Still smoke smell!!! Front desk asked to cash a check , the 1 st person didn't know if they could do that! Front desk check in was rude! Same woman I first spoke when trying to make reservations! Told me they were VERY busy and just could not get us in our room! I hadn't ask to get in room as we were going to the strip!! Overall the 500 dollars for the room was extremely high for the service & rudeness.

Reviews.Title: “Loud air conditioner all the time”
Reviews.Author: Margaret Ann H
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed everything except the loud air conditioner. Could not figure out how to turn the fan to a lower speed so I called the front desk. I was told when they built this hotel the air could not be controlled by the guest. If you get tired of the noise they will turn it off and when you need it back on you have to call again and request it to be turned back on. Have never been anywhere where you could not control your own room for comfort. Had to listen to the very loud fan the whole time I was in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: wps24
Reviews.Content: We had a one night stay on a weeknight. This was a very quite, comfortable hotel. Everything was very clean. The bathroom was a little roomier than what we often see in hotels. The bed was comfortable. We loved the location right on the Landing. It was nice to be able to just walk downstairs for dinner and shopping. I hope to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Will only go to Branson if there is a room available at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Johnn C
Reviews.Content: I go to Branson at least once every year, but I only go when I can stay at the Hilton Promenade. I travel all over the country working for the Federal Government and the staff at the Promenade are the best in the country. Very friendly and helpful at check in and at check out. Always ready to help at any time of day or night and never any attitude! The suites are always perfect with every detail just right. Have already planned my stay for July 23, 2012 thru July 25, 2012 and cannot wait to get there!

Reviews.Title: “Very disapointed at Hilton”
Reviews.Author: MariAnne H
Reviews.Content: There is only one good thing to say about Hilton Branson Landing - location. Other than that we we very disapointed to our stay. We and a friend couple had made our reservations almost half a year ago, and also confirmed with the reservations manager all the details. We were supposed to get rooms close by, did not happen. We had reserved a junior suite, but there was no balcony as promised nor view, only to the roof and ac units, and it was blocked by a construction device. We were promised the top floor, did not happen. Our friends had to change room, they had their door unlocked one time, there was chew tobacco on the extra bed for a child. The wifi in the room costs 9,95 per day, breakfast cost 14,95 USD. Some of the personnel were very friendly, Paul at the lobby tho mention one. Other staff at the reception very unfriendly. We left and will not be back. Moved to Radisson and are extremely happy about that.

Reviews.Title: “Tissue thin walls”
Reviews.Author: dantillweed
Reviews.Content: As I type this review , I get to hear conversations, tv, and thudding noises from the adjacent rooms, as I am tired and wanting to sleep this is not what I am giving up 35,000 Hilton Honnors points a night for! Add in the fact that my wife wanting to take advantage of the jetted tub, but the hot water gave out 3/4 of the way filled. Now while I wait for hot water so I can take a shower, i get to write a review. This is room 527 in what they call the south tower. Turns out these were built as apartments, and they each have their own small hot water heaters and very poor sound insulation. Of course the Hilton is sold out so we can't get another room here in Branson, so tomorrow it's on the road to Springfield Mo. I don't understand how Hilton keeps rating these low quality hotels as deluxe resorts,(ex the now not Las Vegas Hilton, which drove me to Marriott as my primary hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Views but no service.”
Reviews.Author: Tangledteacher1
Reviews.Content: Amazing views, the light show was fantastic. The room is beautiful and spacious. Having said that, the clerk taking reservations did not speak fluently nor understand English. There was a line 10 people long and one person working at check in. In other areas, as well, the employees seem clueless. It's worth staying here as long as you get a balcony with a view of the light show. Set your standards low as far as the enployees go and don't expect 'Hilton service'.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Clean, updated rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Leah C
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property in Branson several times. Each time, the service has been good and the property location is excellent. It is directly on the Branson Landing, just steps from great restaurants and shopping. The rooms are beautiful - very plush and updated. I always feel comfortable staying here. Even though each time I've visited, it's been for business, it really makes me feel like I'm on vacation! The only reason I didn't give it a 5 rating is because the last time I stayed there, there was a strong smell of must/mold in the hallways (3rd floor). I assume this was from the spring tornado that went through Branson this year, and did some cosmetic damage. I'm sure this is being worked on, and it did not affect my stay at the all. The room was clean and fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Damaged by a recent tornado, but still nice”
Reviews.Author: Honest_Mitch
Reviews.Content: I attended a convention at the Hilton Convention Center this month. Unfortunately, I could not stay in the convention center because it was hit by a tornado a few weeks ago. Instead, I got a room at Hilton Promenade. They are across the street from each other. The room was well appointed and clean. The service was incredible. My room faced the road and convention center, but I only slept in the room. The rest of the time, I was attending meetings. Thus, no big deal. However, if it matters to you, you might want to request a room overlooking the landing. There were eight or nine hundred (800 - 900) people at the conference. The convention center was plenty big enough. I was amazed at the efficiency of service and quality of food. Kudos to the staff for getting hundreds of folks through the buffet in less than 30 minutes. I will be back next year, and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “5 star service! Perfect Location! Wonderful Rooms with a View!”
Reviews.Author: happytillie
Reviews.Content: We had left the Westgate Emerald Point hotel after a horrible experience so we checked out and went to the Hilton at Branson Landing. When we called them directly they were more than happy to accomondate us and had heard Emerald Point had dirty rooms and rude service. Not at the Hilton. We were pampered to make up for the bad experience we had at Emerald Point. They gave us a free upgrade and 3 rooms with a view of the Landing. Walk out of the hotel and many dining choices. Free WiFi that actually worked. Room was beautiful, clean and 5 star all the way. The price was well worth the service we received. Staff thanked us countless times for staying with them. We will stay here the next time we come to Branson at the end of the summer. This hotel was wonderful in every aspect and would highly reccommend it to everyone we know going to Branson during their summer stay. It was Perfect and a safe place for kids.

Reviews.Title: “a little bit of awsomeness!”
Reviews.Author: spyle31
Reviews.Content: A couple of hundred bucks a night, but worth it for the hilton quality. Just a stones throw from Lake Taneycomo, the musical fountain, and more restaurantes and shopping than you can stand. It is where the action is at. Huge motorcycle rally and American Idol contestants are only a couple of the cool things we saw while looking off our balcony. We reveived $150 dollars worth of shopping coupons which almost paid for our room.

Reviews.Title: “Location is GREAT, rooms are just ok”
Reviews.Author: foxy_mom4
Reviews.Content: If you enjoy spending a lot of time shopping on Branson Landing the hotel is in a great location. However, the price and quality of the rooms, may not outweigh the location. The rooms are small, the bathrooms are large, with a fantastic walkin shower. The room also had a balcony that overlooked the train station, where trains do come through and blow their wistles at ALL hours of the night. The room had a small bar area with microwave and fridge, but with so many resturant choices around, we didn't really utliize this feature. The hotel has two towers, and we were in the 2nd tower, which meant carting your luggage from the parking garage (free parking NOT included in your stay), through the main building, outside and into the other building. The room was clean, but the hallway and entrance area were in need of some touchups.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton by the Landing”
Reviews.Author: Becky S
Reviews.Content: Modern, close to shopping, food and well everything! Right by the Landing, our room was fabulous, comfortable and had a nice view. Friendly employees, easy check in/check out. Parking garage with easy access to the Hilton is a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Branson”
Reviews.Author: kentdan1
Reviews.Content: Just spent three days on the "Landing" in Branson. Our room was top floor with balcony overlooking the fountain and river. May be the best view in Branson. Hotel is in great shape contrary to what some think after the tornado. The Hilton Convention Center across the street however is still closed. We had a large two room suit with a huuge balcony that stretched around two sides. Shopping and dining were litterally at our door step and the area is safe. The rooms are sound prooffed so night noise from crowds was not an issue. It is a straight shot from the parking area to most entertainment venues. The staff was extrememly friendly and helpful. Went to dualing piano bar near by the last night and had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Fun location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dorothy M
Reviews.Content: Pro: Great location at Branson Landing with shops, restaurants, and the fountains; wonderful, friendly, personable staff members; room had Hilton bathrobes which were great; huge balcony overlooking the shops; lots of great Branson brochures near the front desk; the hotel always felt secure; huge room with nice furniture and several local magazines; nice quality bath supplies. Con: Extra charge for internet access; extra charge for self parking; not the best job of cleaning the rooms is done as there were several white cleaning cloths with cleaning solutions still on them sitting out in the open on a red chair. As another person posted, this hotel is still recovering from tornado damage, so it is not functioning at its peak yet, but hopefully it will be again.

Reviews.Title: “Like everything else, location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Popsie A
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, clean, comfortable & a location that cannot be beat. The walking mall just behind the hotel is Super nice. Several restuarants, many shops, YES Ice Cream. We spent every night down stairs at the mall. You are still within 15 minutes from almost any show. We will be here again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NWABeachFamily
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located directly on the Branson Landing which was very convenient to all the restaurants and shopping. You get off the elevator, take just a few steps, and you are in the middle of all the action. Hotel was extremely quiet and very nice. The size of the room was much larger than a typical hotel room. Restroom and shower were all very large and plenty of room to move around. You definitely won't go wrong on this hotel. Only negative if anything -- you have to pay for self parking in the garage. There really is not another option to park other than in the garage but the hotel charges $8.00 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for shopping”
Reviews.Author: siloamjim
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a place to stay in Branson away from the 76 Strip, but close to lots of shopping and several good places to eat, the Hilton at the Branson Landing is a good choice. The staff members are friendly, rooms are nice (we got a suit with a kitchen), and all of the shops are literally at your doorstep. We looked out of our window and saw the Coldwater Creek sign (my wife's favorite place to shop on the Landing). Bass Pro has a big store there, Kohl's is on the Landing...and dozens more retails stores, plus several restaurants (Cantina Laredo, Joe's Crab Shack, etc.).

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: LadyW56
Reviews.Content: This property is great and located near the river with lots of shops and restaurants within walking distance. The staff were exceptional especially Paul and Ken. The rooms are very spacious and the beds comfy. This is definitely my hotel of choice when visiting Branson!

Reviews.Title: “Best Service I've Ever Encountered”
Reviews.Author: HotelGirl811
Reviews.Content: From start to finish this was by far one of the best hotel stays ever. Paul, Ken, Tim and several others were attentive from start to finish. The hotel rooms are spacious and smartly appointed with warm colors and comfort. This will definitely be our hotel of choice when visiting Branson from now on

Reviews.Title: “Still Recovering from Tornado--but OK”
Reviews.Author: Gene R
Reviews.Content: Tornado damage so half the hotel is closed. Reception personnel very friendly. Room OK--nothing special and decor dated and dark. No coffee cups in the room until we asked, and the person that made the bed needs to be retrained. Also thought it was a little pricey for off season. However, considering the trauma the city had been thru, certainly acceptable. Bathroom was OK--grouting in shower needs attention.

Reviews.Title: “St Louis/Branson, Mo trip”
Reviews.Author: deanna46
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at the Hilton Promenade recently and would highly recommend this hotel. The staff was extremely friendly and very helpful during our entire stay. The room was spacious, clean, quite and the breakfast was great too. Location was ideal for getting around to all the sites and restaurants. Parking was convenient and the garage well lighted and clean. Thank you to all the staff for making our stay comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “What a haven!”
Reviews.Author: racpie
Reviews.Content: It was my first stay at a Hilton. They had a special winter price. We booked it for the weekend and upon arrival was upgraded from a regular room to a jr suite! Gorgeous decor, view of the Landing fountains, roomy bathroom and super clean and pleasant smelling. Coffee on the balcony overlooking the Landing. Ahh I just wish we could have stayed longer. Thank you Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “The best customer service on earth!!”
Reviews.Author: coloradorbust
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed in a Jr suite which was outstanding!! Upon returning home realized we had left several items in room. When i called housekeeping staff were so helpful. They shipped the package to us and we received in 2 days. Amazing!! Previuosly we had stayed and were not 100% satisfied. This trip it was beyond our expecations!! Thank you Hilton

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hilton, minor annoyances”
Reviews.Author: Mike W
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel using HHonors points for a nice family weekend getaway. This hotel and it's sister property across the street had both sustained damage in recent tornados. The sister property remained closed and Promenade struggled to accommodate the guests from both properties. When we checked in the front desk was very apologetic that they couldn't upgrade me. That surprised me because, as a Diamond member I have never been upgraded either paid or using points. Alas the hotel was full so no upgrade. They did, however, comp parking and breakfast so no complaints here. Rooms were spacious and clean, although the grout on the bathroom floor needed scrubbed. My only complaint was the air conditioner / heater in the room sounded like a jet engine! Couldn't get it to shut off and it was SOO loud. We had trouble sleeping. Breakfast buffet was good in the morning but pancakes my son ordered took too long to cook and were delivered just as we were walking out the door. Location is everything here. That was the best part!

Reviews.Title: “Cheer Championship”
Reviews.Author: Beverly R
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our time there but there is one thing that confuses me...down to the floor where the competition is held is an escalator. Unfortunately there is NOT one that carries you back up to where the cheerleaders are while they are getting ready for the competition.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MOViking
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed our stay here. It is what you would expect from a Hilton. If I was to return to Branson, I would stay here again. Our price was very reasonable at $109 per night in Ferbruary. Keep in mind everything is extra, parking costs $8 a night, no complimentary coffee or breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Roomy, clean, and elegant”
Reviews.Author: curryjunky
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were placed in room 503 at the Hilton Promenade in Branson on the landing during a summer winds vacation package deal. The hotel is lovely and is smack dab in the middle of the landing which is perfect location. I can't say anything about the pricing but I do know that they will charge you for breakfast (quite a lot, over $10 for continental room service) and internet access. However, the rooms are large and spacious with a very lovely bathroom (ours included a shower and a bathtub which was very pleasant). The only drawback was that our AC/Heater unit would not shut off and when the heater kicked on, the dust within the exhaust seemed to start burning causing that first-time-heater smell throughout the room. We had the engineer come up just in case due to safety concerns but he assured us that's all it was. The employees were very nice as well as the Brookside restaurant downstairs. You can valet your car or self park in the garage directly next door. Unfortunately you must walk very briefly outside to get to the garage (just a few yards) so if it rains, you will get a tad wet. The music can be quite loud during the day and early evening that is played on the Landing. It's no obscene, though, when you're in the room so it wasn't a concern to us. The beds were mostly cozy except mine was a bit soft giving me a few sore muscles in the mornings (however, I'm a pretty big guy so I didn't expect anything different). One plus is that there's plenty of electrical outlets throughout the room to charge phones/computers/whatever. There was no divider material between the curtain and the outside window so we couldn't truly enjoy the sun wihout having the condos across the landing see right into our room. Overal it was a good hotel. I would recommend it but again, I can't comment on the pricing.

Reviews.Title: “Love all the convenience”
Reviews.Author: CDEMOM
Reviews.Content: Staying here at the South Tower Apartment for 2 nights. Everything is so connected. Form Parking Garage to Hotel and the South Tower. Everyone is extremely friendly. Shopping, Restaurants, Fountain, and the Historic Branson Downtown.is all in less than 5 minutes walking distance. The music at the Landing didnot bother us once the window or balcony door is closed.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: tulsacats
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a condo, which overlooked the center. Nice accommodations. The continental breakfast had stale pastries, but it is the off season. We did not enjoy the music piped into Branson Landing, but at least it silenced at 9. Close to good dining

Reviews.Title: “Love It!! Love It!! Love It!!”
Reviews.Author: Susan H
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family at the Hilton Promenade the weekend before Christmas. We had two rooms, a regular 2-queen-bed room and a one-bedroom condo facing the fountain. Both rooms were spotlessly clean and well-appointed. Love the huge bathrooms!! This was our second stay at this property and really enjoyed it. In fact, we love the Branson Landing area so much that we have now bought a two-bedroom condo just diagonal from the Hilton facing the fountain. It is a wonderful area for shopping, eating, relaxing, etc. As for the Hilton Promenade at Branson Landing, you won't be disappointed. However, I am perplexed as to why a hotel of this caliber charges for wi-fi when the lesser hotels offer it for free. When you pay $1300.00 for a weekend stay-(albeit two units)- free wi-fi and parking would be much appreciated. Just sayin. We would definitely return though.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel..will likely stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Travelmomma78
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel over Thanksgiving weekend. We were upgraded to a King Superior Condo, which overlooked the promenade of shops. We did however, have to walk out of the main hotel building over to another building. The weather was pretty nice so it was not a problem. We had to wait an extra hour before our room was ready for occupancy. The condo was very nice with a comfortable bed, a huge bathroom with plenty of towels, a nice kitchen area and living room, It also had a small walk out balcony with a table and chairs. We didn't visit the pool area which is located in the main building, so I can't comment on it. A small bar restaurant is also located in the main building and served breakfast. The food was okay. In regards to prices, I would say the Hilton Hotels in downtown Branson are a little over priced, especially when you have to pay for parking but we will probably stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: temmert45
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property and their sister property at the Convention center before. It is very well situated away from the crowds of Branson and right on the Branson Landing entertainment area. First, let me say that the issues I had with my reservation was due to hotels.com and not the Hilton company. The staff at the Hilton worked very hard to sort out Hotel.com's problems and came through with a good alternative to what we had requested. I don't think I will ever use Hotels.com again if this is what their usual service is. The Hilton itself is very nice. Super clean and great staff. Our room was spacious, clean and well appointed. What my family likes is that it is out the door and straight out onto the Branson Landing area for shopping. The pool area is clean and well kept up. The workout room was well maintained and the equipment that i used was it great condition and in good working order. The one and only issue I had was when my son and I ate breakfast at the San Francisco Oven at the hotel. We had the breakfast buffet and grabbing a plate to start the buffet. We had to go through two or three plates before we found clean ones. I brought it to the attention of one of the restaurant staff and they immediately took all the plates to the back and brought out a new stack that looked clean and shiny. The restaurant could have used better policing of dirty dishes and cups in the dining area. Other than that one thing, it is probably one of my favorite hotel properties in the U.S.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel at the Landing!”
Reviews.Author: Conrads_Travels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed here several times in the past couple of years. We have stayed in a couple different rooms, the general king and the condo. Hilton brand is always super clean, staff are always friendly and helpful. There is a parking garage and you do have to pay for parking, however, if you do not use the valet service then it is much cheaper. Rooms are modern and tastefully decorated as well as immaculately clean. The hotel is in a great location and is right on the Landing with convenient access to everything. There is an indoor pool and weight room available, as well as a San Francisco Oven casual restaurant, that serves breakfast as well. We have also ordered breakfast through room service, which is pricey but very good. There isn't a nice restaurant located directly in the hotel but you really do not need it since the location is such that you have access to all of the restaurants on the Landing. We usually stay here about once a year and we have never had any issues with this hotel for any reason. It is appropriate for all individuals including singles, business travel, trips with friends, couples and families!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and great view”
Reviews.Author: 8675309bergman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for work holiday party. Large room that overlooked square. Room had full size stove, refrigerator, dishwasher, and was fully stocked with dishes. Comfortable bed and large Jacuzzi hot tub. Would stay again when visiting Branson. Loud music outside from shopping area but I did not hear after 10 p.m.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great property, great staff = great experience”
Reviews.Author: 12Travelagain
Reviews.Content: Frequent business traveler so I stay in many different Hilton brand properties. This property makes my favorites list. The location is great, property is kept in good condition, and the staff is always friendly. There is a parking garage so you do pay for parking. Don't let this be a deal breaker for you though. In a property like this you should expect to have to park. Rooms are comfortable and the property is fairly quiet. Being on the landing is great. Plenty of places to go eat or go shopping at.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodation and service”
Reviews.Author: sweetgirlSt_Louis
Reviews.Content: I drive to Springfield,Mo and Harrison, Arkansas frequently for business. Usually I stay at a Hampton Inn in one of the cities. I recently had dinner with clients at Branson's Landing and decided that I did not want to drive 30 miles in either direction to spend the night and decided to see what Hilton had to offer. I was pleasantly surprised. When I asked for a quiet, clean and safe room (my standard request when traveling alone), the reservation clerk upgraded me to one of their condos for the price of a regular double room. The room was large, spacious with a living area, kitchen and oversized bathroom. The work desk was extremely large and greatly appreciated as I spent several hours working the following morning. The room overlooked the Landing and was quiet and peaceful. It had a large balcony although I didn't indulge because it was quite cold. It was quite a nice option to have - certainly more "luxurious" than the other options in the Springfield/Branson/Harrison area. If the opportunity presents itself again, I will certainly stay at the Promenade. The only downside was that I had to pay $10.00 for internet service but given the price of the room, it was not an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Branson Jewel”
Reviews.Author: lisantrvl
Reviews.Content: We recently had a customer event at the Hilton Promenade in Branson, it was an awesome hotel, right on Branson Landing, I had a suite as the event coordinator and it was absolutely beautiful room. Lot's of shopping and restaurants right there made it really nice. We had our dinner banquets over at the Hilton Convention Center, the meals were the best I have had for a hotel dinner banquet buffet, the staff really went above and beyond to make sure everything was acceptable and my hat's off to the chef, the food was incredible. We plan on having our meetings in Branson again, just because the whole experience was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service, but proactivity would help”
Reviews.Author: kevster28
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel several times (>5), some for work, some for fun. Every visit has been good. This stay would have been 5 stars, except for some issues they could have avoided with a little bit of pro-activity. More on that in a minute. In case you aren't aware, this hotel has both regular rooms and condo/suite rooms. If you get the chance, upgrade to the condo rooms. These are equivalent to a full-sized 1 bedroom condo, with full kitchen, 2 flat panel TVs, nice balcony, and a large bathroom with separate shower and jacuzzi tub. On this particular visit, my wife and I were in Branson for a getaway, and to get started on our Christmas shopping. I booked a "bed & breakfast" rate, and they upgraded us to the condo (I'm also a HHonors "vip"). Great start! As I said, most of our stay was great. But there were a couple of things that caused me to think that management of the property has gotten a bit lax: First, when we arrived, there was a room service tray outside the room from the previous occupants' breakfast. This was at 3:30 p.m. Yuck. Unfortunately, this turned out to be an omen. Second, when we settled in for the night, we had an issue with the clock radio. It seemed "off" on its ability to keep time. When we tried to determine what time it really was, there weren't 2 clocks in the room that said the same time. The microwave said 3 a.m., the oven said the normal time (though a few minutes fast), and the bedside alarm clock was set to daylight savings time, and was broken/could not be reset, nor could an alarm be set. Instead, we set up a wake-up call, and it didn't work. We overslept and missed our included breakfast. My request for pro-activity: when DST ends, reset the clocks in the room and make sure they work. Third, after the alarm-clock fiasco, I went to make coffee in the fantastic kitchen (since we missed breakfast). It wasn't until the coffee should have been finished that I realized it wasn't working. There was water all over the counter, and we had no coffee. And we had no breakfast. I am happy to say that the Hilton MADE RIGHT our issues with the clocks & missed breakfast by honoring our voucher through room service, and by crediting our bill with $50. It was a nice gesture. They also brought us a new coffee maker, which worked, mostly, the second day. Fourth, our room service tray from day-one breakfast sat in the hall, literally, ALL DAY and ALL NIGHT. The next morning, our second morning, I found that another annoyed guest had put the tray immediately in front of our room. This tray was 24 hours old. I called housekeeping to complain, and they picked it up. This is my second request for pro-activity: when someone orders room service, a staff member needs to have the assignment of picking up the remnants of same. The hotel is upscale and lovely. The front desk staff and bellmen are wonderful. Our room was clean. The location is fantastic. If you are taking a shopping trip to Branson, this is a great place to stay. And honestly, even with the minor issues we had, we will return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy upscale hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leah C
Reviews.Content: Got a great price...rooms are magnificent but it is so noisy and the shower is lousy. Perfect location. Just be prepared and bring ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, location and view of the river.”
Reviews.Author: bgregoryWichitaKs
Reviews.Content: Right on the landing, try and get a room on the river side and watch the beautiful choreographed water display at night. If you like a great family area, and want to experience what this country must have been like 50 years ago, come to Branson. No crime, great fishing, golf, shopping (without fear of getting mugged) great food. There's a wine store just up the street in old town. The hotel is new and perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, contemporary and great service”
Reviews.Author: td397
Reviews.Content: Everything you would expect from a Hilton hotel. Located along the "river" district of Branson - called the Landing, this hotel redefines Branson's accommodations. The hotel is very well appointed and yu feel like you are staying in a big city property...not Branson! Location, Amenities and room quality is next to none in Branson. One con from our stay: 10 bucks internet. no free wifi. Internet was very slow and bad too.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Spousetoo
Reviews.Content: I've been in this hotel at least twice before as a speaker for a convention program. I didn't realize i had been put in an upper tier room on those occasions. so perhaps this is just my fault, but i made a reservation to take my husband back there so he could see how lovely this area is. i requested a room on the "promenade" overlooking the fountain. i made my reservation online and just picked a standard king room -- i knew i didn't need a suite. I even put my request in our online reservation form (i am beginning to think those parts of the reservation form are worthless!). when we got there, we were told it would have cost extra for such a room and no, they couldn't give us one at any price because none were available. our room overlooked the condo units to the south. the clerk claimed we could look off to the side to see the fountain, but we would have had to hang from our toes from the windowsill and even then, unless we could have stretched out a good ten feet long -- there was no ways to have seen the fountain. in short, that was a ridiculous claim and why they let the desk staff say something as stupid as that is beyond me! so, i was disappointed. i suppose it's my own fault, but i wish i'd have gotten a warning that my request required more money in time to have considered that option. otherwise, the room was nice and clean. wifi is pricy, as with all such upper tier hotels. parking (self) is $8 a day. but starbucks is just half a block to the west and there's shopping in every direction. we were on the south side of the hotel near the trains but they didn't bother me. however, they were not outside my window. perhaps that's something to be cautious of if your room is at the southwest corner of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Richdeni
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a one bedroom condo which overlooked the street where the stores were. It was nice to sit on the patio and watch the shoppers. The unit was beautiful with granite and stainless steel in the kitchen. A nice size kitchen, large living area, large bathroom and medium size bedroom made for a very enjoyable stay. The only problem was it was a long way to the parking garage. I kept telling myself it was good exercise but we had already stayed four days on 76 enjoying the shows, outlet malls and wineries where I had done a lot of walking.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business or couples”
Reviews.Author: formykids135
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Branson Landing Hilton several times on business, never had a bad experience. The rooms are not huge but I consider them plush and very relaxing. A few times I've been upgraded to a suite. Great location on Branson Landing. Nice little hotel bar too.

Reviews.Title: “Branson Landing”
Reviews.Author: traveleyesok
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with good views of the landing. Nice to walk in and out, do shopping, return to your room, etc. Hotel was clean. Had to walk to parking garage in the rain, it isn't attached to the hotel, which was a bummer. Also your hotel room may not be attached to the main hotel, you may have to walk outside to get to your building, not a deal breaker, but bummer if the weather is bad! Would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Just What you Would Expect from a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: WindstarTravelGirl
Reviews.Content: Downtown. Close drive to all the Hwy 76 Attractions. Traffic is just as bad here as on the strip now. I really do love the Shopping area and the dining outside. The fountain and outside vendors are really a nice touch. It's a little city all on it's own. The hotel is very clean and upscale. Of course, if you are going to get the real "Branson" experience - here is not the place. Very commercialized and as with all Hiltons - you do pay for everything including parking and wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: JParkinson1941
Reviews.Content: Our friends recommended this hotel. This was our first visit to Branson and I am glad we took their recommendation and didn't stay at one of the 'strip' hotels. We booked a condo suite for our three night stay, it was beautiful. We were close to shopping and dining and enjoyed the entertainment happening on the square. Pet Peeve........paying for WiFi. Why can I get free WiFi at Hampton Inns and Hilton Garden Inns and when we pay twice as much for a hotel they nickel and dime you on WiFi charges.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: TerriMe
Reviews.Content: I am just back from a 2 night stay. Let me just say it was a wonderful 2 night get-a-way for my husband and I. Every employee was very nice and friendly! Received a wonderful unexpected surprise when I arrived and checked in...I was up-graded from a King Deluxe Room to a King Condo......Loved it. Thank you so much Promenade at the Landing for making our get-a-way one we will remember always. We are Branson locals and I have already booked another 2 night stay at this hotel in October.

Reviews.Title: “This is one Hilton that will never get our business again”
Reviews.Author: Kajole
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with 3 teenagers were visiting Branson last June because my daughter was competing in the Stage One Dance Nationals held at the Branson Convention Center across the street. Due to the fact that my daughter needed rest and the 2 teen boys like to stay up late, we rented 2 rooms. The rooms were adequate in size, as were the bathrooms. HOWEVER, we did have some items missing from our room that we discovered after we left. Some of my husband’s medication was missing and my expensive eye glasses were missing. You should also know that my husband tried repeatedly to contact the manager on staff regarding our missing items. No one EVER made an attempt to return his calls. Because of this, we were never given the opportunity to make a formal complaint and list the missing items or to even alert Hilton’s insurance company for compensation. I called Mr. Bill Derbins, the General Manager, to discuss my situation. Mr. Derbins was NOT willing to listen to my problem. He QUICKLY took my name and phone number and told me that the woman in charge of insurance would promptly call me back. That was over a month ago, and I still have NOT heard from them. If you do choose to stay here, lock up any medications or other personal items of value in the safe or keep them with you while you are out of the room. This hotel does not seem to care about their hotel guests concerns; otherwise, they would have returned our calls. My husband is a Gold Card member and we usually stay at Hilton hotels when we vacation. This is one Hilton that will never get our business again, and I will make sure that his company and our friends know about the problems we have had with this Hilton hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Branson in the Heat!”
Reviews.Author: CindyM55
Reviews.Content: Because it was so hot the thought of no pool was disappointing however just across the street at their sister hotel Hilton Convention Center allowed you day passes. Loved the balcony over looking the lake and the Fountain experience although the floods earlier that Spring damaged them and so no shows while we were their for two days. Happy Hour at Waxy O'Sheas was fun and a great deal with in and outside dining. Enjoyed a nice dinner at The Cantina overlooking the lake as well. Lot's of shopping and activity for families.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay but the hilton convention center is better”
Reviews.Author: susiemquizie
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a weekend trip at the promenade and I have to say I was dissappointed. We usually stay at the convention center but it was booked up so we stayed in a doubl queen bed room with a balcony overlooking the fountains. Now on our room key paperwork the lady wrote s413 we could not get our key to work they told us to come down and see what the problem was instead of sending someone up. It wouldn't be so bad but it's far away to go there and back and with a ton of luggage not a whole lot of fun as you can imagine and to my husband's dismay the lady had written the wrong number on our key card info it was supposed to be room 513. Now the view was awesome the room okay. Room cabinets were dusty and my major problem with the place is the two doors into our room. The rooms were being slammed from 7 am on on both mornings and you could hear them yelling housekeeping etc. So if you like to sleep to any reasonable time I would ask not to have one of these rooms where you have to go through mutliple doors to get to your place it's just way too loud and the room accomadations were subpar when comparing to the convention center. I can't say I would stay there again especially when it's higher at the promenade than at the convention center anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel, don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: argirlatheart
Reviews.Content: This is one of the most horrible hotels I have ever stayed at. I paid over $200 per night, per room (2 rooms). One of the rooms was right above a bar that is out on the promenade which had loud music blaring until one in the morning on a weeknight. The other room was so close to the train track that the hotel is built by that I was awakened 4 times in the night (the train was about 50 feet from my window if that far). I complained the next day and I was moved to new rooms, however, I asked for a rebate on both rooms from the night before and was told that I would be comped parking (a whopping $8...when I spent over $900 for 2 nights). One of the worst experiences I've had at a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NO HOT WATER IN THE SHOWER :(”
Reviews.Author: dorissecret
Reviews.Content: We paid 190.00 taxes and valet. We woke up to take a shower and NO HOT WATER.. boo-hiss not worth 190.00 at all.... The valet people were awesome and helpful. The location was good. We walked to all the shops and restaurants . everything was nearby. thanks!!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Macthaddy
Reviews.Content: We booked the Breakfast Get Away option. Although it was in a great location,we were very disappointed The breakfast was the same for three days in a row and they only offered Hazelnut coffee. The staff was polite but could only apologize and said that the management is aware of the guests disappointment with the lack of regular coffee. The room was clean however, the towel rack fell off during our stay. Housekeeping would not replace the drinking glasses with clean ones and would only give you paper.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: BBSlove
Reviews.Content: I must say the rooms are beautiful but the ladies who check you in were very unfriendly to my guest and I. I'm huge on customer service and she was terrible. The valet parking guys were very professional. Overall the ladies at the check in desk have ruined this hotel review for me and everyone who seeks my opinion on it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for American Airlines Points!”
Reviews.Author: cmkover40
Reviews.Content: The hotel is delightful and they upgraded our family of four to a condo. We were up on the 5th floor facing the street, which was not very noisy at all. The restaurants and shopping selection that surround the hotel and excellent, plan ahead on the weekends during dinner time, or you will have to wait. The kids would have enjoyed an outdoor pool on property, but there is a small one across the street at the Hilton Convention Center. Excellent Hotel, would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: dhcolvin
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and great stay! Staff was beyond nice to my 2 year old son and always said hi and made him feel special. I love how this hotel and the Convention Center Hilton across the street are pretty much connected as your key works at both places so you could use both pools/exercise facilities. I had free Internet service (Gold Member) but parking you did have to pay...no biggie though. Overall nothing could of been better as even during a busy time for them you would not know it

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: TYOTP
Reviews.Content: We came to Branson Landing for a Wedding and the Hilton was perfect for our Weekend. Our room was a standard King but it was very roomy, large bathroom, and extremely comfortable bed. All of the weddding activities were right in Branson Landing so everything was a very short walk from the Hilton. It was a very nice place to stay and would recommend staying here. The workout room was small but clean and adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, plenty to do”
Reviews.Author: DAVID S
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay at the Hilton, with 4 kids, and a tired wife we were able to valet park ($12) not bad, get out and walk around the Branson landing for the afternoon and enjoy each other without having to drive anywhere else. Plenty of shopping in the landing as well as numerous food choices which were good. If you want to huff it up the hill downtown Branson is a couple blocks away with Dick's 5&10 a cool store and numerous antique, clothing and nick nack stores. Check it out!

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: texasroadrunner5000
Reviews.Content: Friendly service, big bathrooms, great location, furniture needed dusting, shower needed better cleaning, not enough towels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but some problems..”
Reviews.Author: HeinMax
Reviews.Content: For the positive notes, they had friendly staff, great location and the condo set up was perfect for a family with small kids. Problems that occurred: they advertise washers/driers as amenities, however they charge $3 for one load of soap, and you have to go downstairs and across the walkway! Absolutely ridiculous to charge guests to use what you advertise as an amenity, and to charge $3 per load is crazy. Secondly the SF Oven restaurant at the hotel is awful. Ordered a ham, egg & cheese panini that came with fruit and got eggs & ham on dry toast with no fruit. Not tasty at that. Lastly, the room wasn't that clean (several hairs in bathroom and mildew around base of shower), and had both a beetle and silverfish in the kitchen and bathroom area. Not the worst hotel I've stayed at, but definitely look into other options before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Jcausb
Reviews.Content: We usually travel to Branson about twice per year, although it has been over a year since our last visit. The desk manager Alan recognized me from over a year ago, and found me the best available room for the price. Nice quiet room with a balcony. Just what we needed, some relaxation. We are already planning our next Branson vacation at the Hilton. Thanks again to the staff for making us feel welcome and appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but was nickel and dimed.....”
Reviews.Author: jrt55857
Reviews.Content: Good: nice new hotel, clean and super nice rooms with really comfortable beds. We had a Sr. Discount and I think the rate was less than $110 a night. Great location if you want to just step out and have shops and restaurants available. The California Oven restaurant serves a nice breakfast. Bad: you have to pay to park. $8.00/day for self-park and $12 for valet. We self parked and had absolutely no problems. If you have a disability it might be worth the valet but otherwise not. Breakfast is not included like at most hotels. You have to PAY for WiFi in the room and it costs almost ten dollars PER device for a 24 hr period. Wifi is free in the lobby though. Summary: You pay for the convenience of being next to shops and chain restaurants you probably have at home. Nice hotel but you can probably find similar for cheaper once you account for parking,breakfast and internet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and quality in Branson”
Reviews.Author: jdharper12
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 1 night with my spouse, teenage daughter and 2 toddler boys. I was really worried about the quality of hotel rooms in Branson, especially with the high levels of bed bugs in recent weeks. I always prefer to stay at Hilton properties, so I was pleased to find this hotel on the drive down. The price was great. First the location is beautiful. It sits above an outdoor mall and overlooks the lake. I believe the mall is a Simon property, just like the mall I have at home down the street, so I wasn't surprised to see all of the same chain stores, with a few small dessert-type places thrown in. The restaurants are chains as well, but we were only there for 1 night and with 2 small children it's easiest to find someplace quick and familiar. On the way to dinner my boys found RideMakerz, which is a build-your-own remote control car store. Only a few in the country, and we had a blast making a car for each child. The bellhops were plentiful and helped direct us to our room after we self-parked for $8. The garage is adjacent to the building, and there is a brief exposed walk to the hotel door. Kind of a bummer since it was raining all weekend. The hotel is new and in fantastic shape. Our rooms were clean and well appointed. After dinner, we headed to the hotel pool, like many other families. This was a Friday night, and there were about 10 kids at the pool. It was small, and had a separated hot tub, but all of the kids quickly learned to play together and everyone had a great time. It was a nice relaxing evening. Our breakfast in the morning was comped because of my Hilton status, and served in the lobby restaurant. The quality wasn't as high as I was expecting, but it was free and everyone went away full. I told my family that I couldn't wait to go back and stay there again. It will be the only place I ever stay in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “It wasn't raining in the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Delorean1
Reviews.Content: Took pleasure trip to Branson over Easter weekend. Rained the entire weekend, but had a wonderful time at the hotel...everyone friendly and helpful from front desk to housekeeping; clean room! Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations - Very noisy!”
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property BUT the noise level is unacceptable. We were in a room with a beautiful view of the Branson Landing Fountains. You had to go through 3 doors to get to the room and each door opened into a room with 3 doors. We thought it was odd but had no idea how noisy it would be until the neighbors starting coming in and out at all hours and slamming each of the doors. There's also a vent above the door that is like a direct opening to the hall so you can hear everything!!

Reviews.Title: “Hair in bath tub that never got removed”
Reviews.Author: coloradorbust
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving and wanting to take quick shower, we noticed huge amount of hair on wall of shower. I called front desk and asked if when housekeeping came they could clean it. When they did clean the room they did not remove the huge amount of hair. So i call again the front desk said housekeeping had reported that it had been taken care of so they sent up the supervisor. All she did is remove the hair didnt even clean the whole shower. Gross!!!!! I use to love this place have gone several times in the last year but not again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice hotel -- hard to sleep though”
Reviews.Author: KLD1970
Reviews.Content: The good: clean, nice view, great location to explore Branson Landing, reasonable price, great furniture, beds and bathroom The bad: The room's HVAC ran constantly (it never shuts off...manager said it's a code requirement). It sounds like someone's using a blowdryer in the bathroom. This really dries out the air, dries out your mouth during the night and is very hard to get back to sleep if you wake up during the night. Thermostat was also malfunctioning (not related to it running constantly); sink drain was attached to the stopper, hallway light burned out. Mgr said she'd give me an upgrade on my next stay. We've stayed at the Hilton Convention Center (across the street) and never heard their HVAC unit running?? I think we'll stay at the Convention Center Hilton from now on...a little more pricey and you need to walk 3 minutes to the Landing, but a great outdoor pool and much more quieter than the Promenade.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in Branson”
Reviews.Author: MomInDallas
Reviews.Content: Our family decided to spend Christmas in Branson this year and used Hilton Honor Rewards for this stay. This hotel accepts pets and even gave us food/water bowls for our dog. The staff seems to enjoy the pets as well. Upon arriving, we were happy to learn that we were automatically upgraded to a Condo with a full kitchen but it was located in the South building which was disconnected from the hotel amenities. This wasn't a big thing but when it was 30 degrees out you're more inclined to stay in your room than enjoy the pool which is located in the main hotel area. I found ALL of the employees were very friendly, helpful and accommodating. The view wasn't great as it overlooked a parking lot and train station but unless I'm in Hawaii, it's not crucial. It was great to be able to get up, grab a coffee at the Starbucks across the street and walk the dog alongside the waterfront each morning. Even though it was very cold, it was beautiful. One thing that dissappointed me was the room didn't have a tub; it had a huge shower with not much water pressure. It was also quite difficult shaving in the shower as there was no seat. When I'm on vacation, I always enjoy a bath. On Christmas Day, pretty much everything was closed so I would have enjoyed my "luxury bath". I did enjoy the white fluffy robes and towels. The San Francisco Restaurant was just fine for breakfast and dinner; friendly service. The buffet breakfast will keep you full through lunch and for mom with a preteen boy, that's awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Policy on refund due to weather”
Reviews.Author: vclay
Reviews.Content: We lost close to $800 when we could not make our trip due to weather. Booked with Pricleline and could now obtain any potion of our 3 day reservation. Priceline blamed Hilton and advised us not to contact Hilton. Hilton did not resond to emails. I could see a one day forfiet, bul the entre trip. We've stayed at this hotel before, but never again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robo34
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and nice. We arrived early and waited for a room. They did not have a room available and eventually upgraded us to a suite in the South Tower. It was spacious and very nice with bedroom, huge bathroom, separate living room area and small kitchen. Mostly the hotel staff was very friendly with one exception. While trying to get a hold of my wife in her room I could not get transferred to the room via phone. Because it was a business trip and I could not verify who purchased the room I could not be transferred to the room I was staying in. I'm never impressed when someone goes above and beyond to not help - especially with something so simple. The rest of the staff was friendly and helpful. Nice exercise room. Small indoor pool that looked ok. Parking $8/day, $12 for valet. Hotel is right by the landing with lots of shopping and food. If you like Branson it's a decent location. Ordered pizza at the restaurant in the hotel one night. The staff was friendly but the pizza was not good. Overall, a good stay at a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location, food & entertainment just a walk away”
Reviews.Author: MavMama09
Reviews.Content: The Hilton at Branson Landing was beautiful. They had trendy, beautiful rooms that provided all we needed for a comfortable stay. Large restroom with huge walk-in shower & separate bath tub. They were very accommodating if we needed towels, bath soaps, or anything. Provided hair dryer too. The room was quite spacious; we rented a single queen size bed & it was very comfortable. We had a view that was able to see the water light show from the hotel. Was a little loud until around 10pm with the music from the fountain show.. but nothing too terrible. There was even a table that fit under the desk area so that we could eat in the room if needed. There are tons of wonderful restaurants on the landing & shopping. If you want to do some antique shopping it is just a few blocks away near their downtown area, or of course all the attractions of Branson are close as well. They have an excellent pool & spa area as well at the hotel. We loved it all!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel at an affordable price.”
Reviews.Author: Odometer13
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exceptionally clean and the lobby was beautiful. There's a wonderful outdoor fireplace where you can sit and watch the fire and ice (water fountain) show every hour on the hour. The staff was very accommodating, and we'll definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay for 25th Wedding Anniversary!”
Reviews.Author: jeffandsam
Reviews.Content: This was recommended by a friend who had just spent their honeymoon here and it was a good choice! From the customer service at the front desk (hard to find these days) to the wonderful bed, the stay was awesome. Because they knew it was our 25th wedding anniversary, they gave us a room with a great view of the fountain and lake and they also comped our daily parking fee! I can't say enough about the customer service attitude from the guy that checked us in (I forgot to note his name!) but having a B&B ourselves, customer service is our middle name and SHOULD be for all lodging properties, but most don't know how to do it. This one does. Great place to stay and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for Many Reasons”
Reviews.Author: Traveler2121
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here from a Friday to a Friday. It is right in the Branson Landing lakefront development with shops, restaurants and entertainment nearby, Right across from the hotel is an Irish Pub with indoor and outdoor seating. You can also see the dancing fountains show on the lakefront which has a walkway right next to the Lake. Across the street is the Branson Railway station where you can ride a "vintage train" for about 2 hours. And then a block away is Historic Old Town Branson with Dick's 5 &10 store, the 100 Year Old Branson Cafe and other things. You can also easily take the alternate Red and Blue Routes to get to theatres on the strip from thehotel. The hotel itself is up to Hilton standards and feels new. A nice fitness room and indoor pool with a hot tub. Comfortable mattresses, spacious rooms and flat screen TV's. I travelled with my 84 year old father and we had a handicapped room. The walk in shower was great for him, but there were no chairs in the room that he he could easily sit and get up from. One chair was on wheels and the other was an armchair where you sank low into the seat. My only criticism was the staff seemed "fake friendly." I don't really need to be asked "Hello - how are you doing?" every time I passed the front desk." Parking was right next door and was $8 per day. Easy getting in and out. Overall, if I ever did go back to Branson, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Our first impression was not a lasting one”
Reviews.Author: Hudsonsgram
Reviews.Content: Our room was one that shared a common hallway,a cluster of 3 doors, room # 509 South Tower. Every time the common door opened and closed it was extremely noisy and a light came on that shone into our room through large vents. Needless to say we really had no privacy. We could hear everything being said by anyone in the hallway and anyone in the hallway could hear us, not exactly romantic! In our room was a closet with 3 separate fans that functioned for 3 separate units. The noise in our room was horrible! We did get someone to shut off the fans after our first night stay. We also found all of the noise from the outside activities very annoying. 4 nights with no sleep!! While looking for the remote, I pulled back the sheets to find they were badly soiled at the foot of the bed. It appeared that the sheet had been turned around but not changed! We had been sleeping on these sheets for 3 nights! Very disgusting! I left a note for housekeeping to change them as there policy is to change bedding every 4th night! The general housekeeping was not at the standard that we expect for a Hilton Hotel. We are so very glad to be home! We loved Branson, but would not recommend this hotel to anyone! Huge disappointment, and not cheap!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on the Landing”
Reviews.Author: travelerstreet
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for our one year wedding anniversary. I added a note that it was our anniversary when I booked the hotel. As a Hilton member I thought they might do something nice for our anniversary, but they didn't. The first room we were put in was a great room, but had an awful view. The only thing we could see were the roofs of the shops on the Landing. I called the front desk and asked that since it was our anniversary if they had any other rooms and we were then switched to a 2 queen bed superior room with fountain view. This room had a nice breakfast bar with a fridge and microwave. The bathroom was huge with a shower (no bath tub) and vanity. The room itself was spacious with the 2 queen beds. It had a balcony with a little bistro table set. Great view of the fountains and the Landing. There was also a washer and dryer in the private hall which was shared with one other room. I thought that was an interesting touch. Overall the both rooms we saw were great, except for the view in our first room. I would recommed this hotel if someone wants to stay with a fountain view. Otherwise I would say stay at the Hilton Convention Center right across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: Elly58
Reviews.Content: Best long weekend trip we have had in the midwest, worth the 7 hour drive! Great hotel with great staff. This is a place you can go and park the car and stay for the week. The Bass pro marina has boat rentals, you can view the concerts and water light shows from some of the rooms. Great pool and work out rooms. Be sure you try this one.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: happytourist47
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we've stayed here and I can't praise this hotel enough. The location is perfect - right in the heart of Branson Landing - near downtown, the convention center, and the famous Branson shows. The rooms are lovely and large. It's clean and quiet with great bathrooms! Always something to do within walking distance. Food, stores, entertainment. And, don't miss the Aspire Spa it's wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Quality Business and Travel Experience in the Newest Part of Branson”
Reviews.Author: jmdtraveler
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to Branson, MO on business, and was delighted to stay at the new Hilton Promenade. There are two Hiltons in Branson Landing, and ours was closest to the water. Across the street lies the Hilton attached to the new Convention Center, and travelers should make sure they know which one they're checking into before arriving. Great things about this hotel: check-in was quick and easy, valet parking is convenient and a parking lot beside the hotel easy to access with a room key, and it's well-suited for the business traveler. My room was updated with flat-screen televisions, spacious marble baths, a large desk space with quickly found desk plugs for computers and cell phones. The hotel includes a casual restaurant, and sits adjacent to a courtyard with a lively Irish pub adjacent to it. My room overlooked the courtyard, and there was no noise problem. Outdoor patio diners were very casual and inside, live music can be found most nights. Across the street, in the Hilton Convention Center hotel, is Level 2 Steakhouse, one of the most exceptioonal steakhouse experiences I've had in a while. The attention to detail, right down to your choice of over 20 steak knives, was superb, along with the service. Try the Kansas City Strip and don't miss the butter cake for dessert. It's well worth the splurge. A wealth of shops exists at the landing within walking distance, and a quick trek across the street will get you into historic Branson, where we loved the old timey cafes for breakfast, the five and dime novelties and local town shops that are fun to explore for the afternoon. Away from the theatre district and therefore away from the traffic, you're at your favorite shows within a convenient 15-20 minutes. The upscale accommodations are located close enough to the action without being a part of the daily entertainment venues, providing a true escape in the beauty of the Ozarks. Fly directly into Branson at their new airport, with direct service on Air Tran via Atlanta. The hotel is only 15 minutes away, giving you a beautiful drive along the way. We were also very close to several great golf courses, including Branson Creek and Murder Rock near the airport, and the famed Payne Stewart and Ledgestone. Payne Stewart is connected to the Hilton and stay and play packages are available. Overall terrific experience that shouldn't be missed for business or pleasure, making for a relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a very good experience”
Reviews.Author: vegetarianmom
Reviews.Content: Just getting ready to check out and have had a very good experience. Couple of notes - we took advantage of the "buy two nights get one free" special on the Hilton website. We also took the "room assigned at check in" rate of $179. And we are happy with our room - especially since we picked up free wi-fi from the star bucks across the street. We slept great, quiet and beds are very comfy. Important after a 12 hour road trip. Location- I didn't realize when I booked the hotel but it sits right in the middle of a new shopping mall. At first that was a turn-off but I quickly realized how convenient it would be. We ended every day with dinner and a stroll around the promenade, fountain show - no worries about parking because you're with the hotel. A duck tour and historic downtown Branson are both in walking distance. Only negatives - we lost a/c for a while one night. Hotel was great, offered a room change, brought us a fan and had it fixed in a few hours. Hotel smoothies - the menu states that they contain fruit - however, when I asked the waitress she replied "they taste just like......" OK - I don't order smoothies to get chemicals that taste LIKE fruit - I'm looking for fruit - they need to change the menu or the smoothies. Breakfast service was confusing, food was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with Quirks”
Reviews.Author: Hortman55
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Promenade at Branson Landing is expected to be a full service luxury hotel. It's right in the middle of Branson Landing with many shops, restaurants and tourist attractions. The hotel is well laid out. No problem checking in especially with full service valet parking ($12 a night). It's a long haul with your luggage to your room if you don't use a bellhop to help you. No trolleys in sight for those that want to do their own. The room was very comfortable. Good air condtioning controls and plenty of space inside to spread out. What we didn't know and weren't told was that the queen superior room we were given did not have a bathtub, only a shower. This was a major disappointment for anyone that prefers a bath to a shower. Don't know if any room had a bathtub or they had just no rooms available with one but we were told there were none to be had. Room service was sad. They only brought half the order the first day and no one answered the phone the second day---you had to live a message on the recorder which they never returned. Had to call back before we go someone. Also, valet parking is nice only if someone answers the phone. After letting it ring for about 30x's, I called back to the operator to get my car brought down. Checkout was quick and no problem with valet parking or bellhop this time. Overall, a good stay but could have been better. You expect a little better from an upscale Hilton such as this one.

Reviews.Title: “So fun!”
Reviews.Author: Allison67
