Reviews.Content: Great place to stay! Good shopping and restaurants within walking distance; made for a fun stay with the whole family! Something fun for all age groups!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location,Location”
Reviews.Author: Thebarrs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights what a great location and the hotel upgraded us which was lovely. The SFO resturant was great served great breakfasts and the best decaf coffee I have ever tasted:) The waitress Tina was very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Manager rude and a little dissappointed in the room”
Reviews.Author: ConsumerAdvocate01
Reviews.Content: No tub, nothing to sit on in the shower,(this was suppose to be a SUPERIOR room) door to the furnace closet dirty, no trash can in kitchen area, so everytime we made coffee and other trash we had to walk in the bathroom to throw our trash away. No dish towels to wipe kitchen counter , the hallroom doors BANGED extremely LOUD everytime someone closed a door (we had teenagers next door). Other than the Manager, the Staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: travelfanarkansas
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel several times. Every time the rooms and service are stellar. We upgraded to a one bedroom condo with a balcony that over looks the Branson Landing outdoor mall. We could see the water fountains from our room. The bell hop and vallet guys are just wonderful. Friendly, helpful, always going the extra mile in service. This hotel makes your vacation top notch because you dont have to worry about anything! They do it all! Thanks!!!

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: TheGaddys
Reviews.Content: We chose a room overlooking the fountain. The view was really great. The room was very nice. The bathroom was spacious, as was the shower. The room had a microwave, coffee pot, sink, a fridge with an ice maker, flat screen tv, and desk. We bought the breakfast package which included a buffet style breakfast - bagels, bacon, ham, sausage links, eggs, french toast, biscuits, gravy, cereals, etc. The food was good, and the service was AWESOME! We will stay here again. CONS: Internet was $10/day, and parking was $8.

Reviews.Title: “Large, beautiful room in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: gourmand916
Reviews.Content: The amenities of a luxury hotel -- decor, marble/granite, linens, etc., all in a very large room in the heart of Branson Landing. Situated on the corner with the best restaurants and the entertainment plaza, this is a refreshing change from the over-used hillbilly motif in many of the mom & pop motels around town. Great home base for food and night life. Plus, they allow you to use the great swimming pool in their sister hotel across the street. Nice fitness facility and indoor pool on site.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location on Branson Landing ~ Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: yakadi
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just returned from a fabulous visit & stay at the Hilton Promenade at the Branson Landing. We chose this hotel because we visited Branson last year and we our hotel was located on the main "strip" of 76 in Branson and we had to drive to the Landing which we didn't like very much. This Hilton is located, literally, on the Landing and offers smoking rooms. It was just as wonderful as we thought it would be. The location cannot be beat! You can look out your hotel window and see the shops and the water/fire fountains and the people walking below. You can walk out the side door of your hotel and you are immediately standing in front of the fire/water fountains on the landing. If you aren't familiar with the landing, this means you are in the middle of the shopping and eating walking area by the water ~ we ate at Joe's Crab Shack (to your left) and purchased a new suitcase at Totes (to your left) and the next day purchased some items at Kirkland's (on your right) and saw Bass Pro (on your right) and basically... we walked, ate, shopped, etc... all within three minutes of our hotel, max. We were super happy with the location of the hotel because you can park and never drive again until you leave town. As for the hotel... it was definitey Hilton standards all the way... everyone from the valet to housekeeping was extremely nice. Self-parking in their covered lot is $8 a night and valet parking is $12 a night. We did self-parking and had zero problems. The lobby is beautiful. There are one or two restaurants on the main floor but we didn't use them. The pool and fitness center is also on the main floor ~ though I wasn't happy with the fact that everyone walking-in from parking can see directly into the pool area ~ no privacy whatsoever. Our room was spectacular - huge, jettted tub, separate enclosed glass/rain shower, very spacious room and very spacious bathroom, clean, modern bed linens and curtains. We could open the curtains and see the fountain from our room or close them and it would be completely black. We were in a very busy area with a pub below us and couldn't hear a peep ~ it was very quiet in our room. Nice. We plan to stay here everytime we visit Branson ~ which is about twice a year. For us, it is worth it to just park, walk, eat, have a few drinks, and walk back to our room. Very nice!

Reviews.Title: “"Smoke-free" hotel was one of the smokiest hotels I've ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: JerryTriptaker
Reviews.Content: On our first night, we checked in put our luggage in the room and went out to eat. When we got back to the room it had been raining and we found that the rain gutter was making a lot of noise that could not be ignored in the bedroom. We called down to the front desk and they were able to move us to a new room. If we had only stayed the one night we would have been very pleased with everything and probably would have rated the hotel as a four (very good). However, on the second night when we returned from a show the room stank of cigarette smoke. We called the front desk and they assured us that the entire hotel is "smoke-free". Then they made the excuse that if someone is smoking on a balcony near our room that the smoke will be pulled into the nearby rooms. This was strong and continuous, I doubt that it was someone outside because the smell didn't let up all night and got even stronger in the morning. The hotel should have been designed to prevent a few rule-breaking guests from ruining other guest's stay.

Reviews.Title: “Free Upgrade to a Condo! Huge Room! Terrible Shower Head”
Reviews.Author: Governmentemployee
Reviews.Content: To keep it short, if you're a gov't employee make sure you ask for the gov't rate $70! As a HH member I was upgraded to a condo for free and spouse stayed free! We were on the 4th floor overlooking the mall with a balcony! It was fantastic especially for $70! The only negatives were the shower head which was TERRIBLE and the TV in the bedroom was in the wrong spot and it couldn't be turned to face the bed. I couldn't believe the $20 shower head in the 150' bathroom with marble tile and a whilpool! Park at Belks and walk, saves another $8 a day and it's not that much further than the parking garage.

Reviews.Title: “Stay out of South Tower”
Reviews.Author: mntbikegolfer1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 3 nights in the South tower near and above the Waxy o sheas pub. Our room also faced the street instead of the landing shopping. The room was nice and clean and fresh linens and a tidy up were brought daily. The room was noisy do to the road and the bands that played at the pud on Fri and Sat night. The location of the hotel is great for shopping and playing golf at the Payne Stewart course just stay out of the south tower and any road side rooms! Parking is minimal so they charge you $8.00 a day to self park in the parking garage. It was my wife's birthday so a friend of ours called in a wine and cheese tray that the hotel staff managed to botch up. The new Payne Stewart course awesome and very challenging. MG

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: dacamman
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Diamond member and stay at a lot of Hilton properties. This location by far was one of the best. Within walking distance to shopping, food, and other local attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a top Hilton Property”
Reviews.Author: DiverDown79
Reviews.Content: Was a bit nervous at first going to Branson & Hilton - just never expected a high-class property here. Hotel was easy to find, but the driveway tends to back up and make check-in a bit difficult. I ended up backing in to the driveway. Check-in was professional & no complaints - some travelers seemed upset that their rooms were in different buildings (I think Hilton has 2 or 3 different ones in this "mall"). Luckily mine was in the same building, but the rooms weren't in numerical order. I was a "VIP" guest with a local business and didn't expect my room category: a junior suite. Brand new furnishings, very comfortable sofa & bed, bathroom the size of most budget hotel rooms, and terricloth robes. My suite was on the top floor & corner facing the Fire/Light show in the mall square, and the balcony had 2 very large tables and chairs - this room is definitely the 'entertainment' suite. I was afraid I'd hear noise all night from the events below, and it was amazingly 'sound proof' to an extent. Overall, was on par with most of the newer Hiltons.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but worth it”
Reviews.Author: TravelinTracy
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because of its location on Branson Landing. We paid extra for a room with a view of the "dancing waters" on the landing. The room was large, with a huge and fabulous bathroom (shower only, but what a shower!) and a balcony. Some rooms have larger balconies than others, so if this is an issue, discuss it when making your reservation. Also, be sure to ask for the south tower - as others have mentioned, the north tower is completely separate from the building that houses the restaurant and indoor pool. In general, we were very pleased with the service. It took forever to check in, but the staff was courteous and even offered us free drinks from the tiny convenience store. On our second night, we heard a dog barking in a room on our floor (no, it's not a pet friendly hotel!). When we called to report it, the manager said he'd had several complaints and asked us to try and help pinpoint the location, so we knew they were trying to take care of it. Later they called back, told us the family with the dog had been asked to leave, and gave us a free breakfast. Breakfast was delicious but would have been ridiculously expensive if it hadn't been comped. And the waitress kind of had her head in the clouds. As for the location, Branson Landing is right outside your door. It's basically your typical suburban mall, but in an outdoor setting. However, if you turn the other way you'll see smaller, non-chain shops, so you've got the best of both worlds right there.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: stewartriorancho
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay. We loved it! The only thing that wasn't cool was no breakfast. Very comfy! The Landing was right outside. Plenty to do and see!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Ultimatetravelking
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the middle of Branson Landing. There are shops and restaurants right outside of the door. It is especially nice to have the restaurants so conveniently located when you arrive late at night and do not feel like driving around town. The front desk was very friendly. They were extremely accommodating. It was quick to check in and they leave the bill under your door so there is no need to check out. How much more convenient can you get? The room was very quiet. The beds slept well. There was a microwave and a refrigerator in the room. It was nice to have a flat screen HDTV with plenty of channels. It is a bit of a walk from the parking garage to the rooms. And, they need a sign to explain how the hotel portion of the parking works. Hint - you have to push the buzzer and they look up your reservation. Overall this was by far the best accommodations I have had in Branson. Is it worth the price? Well, at least for one visit it is. The bill runs up very quickly. Use this hotel for special occasions and you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel....But.....”
Reviews.Author: Oklahoma2thDr
Reviews.Content: We arrived with our 2 children and another couple. While waiting in line to check in, we overheard the gentleman in line state that he just went up to his room and walked in on other people in his room, that wasnt the worst part. It was his second room assignment, given to him after he had walked in on a naked couple on his 1st room assignment. Apparently the computer double booked rooms. Needless to say we kept the inside lock on at all times. We were also told that our friends were in the south tower and we were in the north tower. No problem, until we discovered the north tower is a completely different building that we had to walk to out in the pouring rain with our kids and luggage. No covered walkway. It may not be too bad in good weather but we had rain the entire weekend. So ask for the south tower to avoid the trek over to the other building. The rooms were spacious and clean. We had a huge walk in shower with the worst shower head in history. It was placed so far up, and had so few spray nozzles that you were getting hit with about 8 sprays of water at a time. No tub to wash the kids hair. Took a long time to get the shower. Im not just being picky, It was really bad. When we saw our friends the next morning we bothblurted out how bad the sower head was at the same time. We had purchased the breakfast option with our stay and was surprised that it was at the other Hilton. We had to wait for the shuttle and the restaurant was woefully understaffed. Amazing since it was Memorial weekend. Overall, the room was comfortable except the showerhead, but the location issues were too much of an issue for us to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: kh895
Reviews.Content: I wanted to try this hotel and spend a little extra. I usually stay on the strip and pay half the price in regular hotels. This was expensive and parking was not convenient. It was a nice hotel but I won't stay here again because it just wasn't worth all the extra money. Parking is $8 a day and I decided to park at the end of the mall and not pay anything which is okay if you don't mind a short walk.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Branson”
Reviews.Author: DownSouthUS
Reviews.Content: Very nice new property in the new "life style center" downtown. There is even a Bass Pro shop at the end of the development. Hotel is very nice. . comfortable, spacious and in a great location. . . My second trip here .. the first in Summer 2008 was a disaster and my concerns resulted in a comp night.. Much better this time. . You need to read the signs carefully about the parking garage where I had problems last summer. . my experiences them caused me to have no problems on this trip. Certainly not the cheapest place in Branson but a respite from all the commotion along the strip where most lodging and shows are located. Staff is very good . Bradley, the assistantt manager, is the one who responded to my problems last summer and made them right this time. Most places in Branson advertise free wifi.. here it cost $10 a day in rooms but free in the lobby. . duh? The Breakfast Buffet was okay and probably the best around but still a little on the side needing improving. .service was good and attentive. If you are going to Branson, this is probably THE place to stay (along with its sister property just down the street). Hilton has brought a new level of lodging and service to the Branson tourist mecca.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, this place is worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: NachoTraveler
Reviews.Content: This place is the place to go in the midwest, great location right on Branson Landing. The Condo was amazing, Granite everything, Jacuzzi, Stand Up Shower, Two LCD TV's, what more do you need? Full kitchen, deck overlooking the landing. This is a great getaway for anyone! The only thing that was a little off was the staff, not super friendly but we didn't see them but twice so no biggie! Be sure to check out the mexican restaurant on the landing, we ate there twice and it was amazing. Stay away from Joe's Crab Shack....worst sea food ever!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Landing”
Reviews.Author: arkified
Reviews.Content: Hotel is always great. Can't believe for the price they charge $9.95 for wi-fi when all you have to do is a search and find free wi-fi around. Everything else about the hotel is outstanding! Even Super 8 gives you free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Great Wheelchair Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Bob E
Reviews.Content: After a year of hospitalizations, physical therapies and wheelchair acclimation my wife and I were ready to "get away". We booked the Hilton at Branson Landing because of it's accessibility to restaurants, shopping and the lake. We were not disappointed one bit! We were able to park our ramp van and not have to use it the three days that we were there. The attractions were fun, the food great and the setting just very relaxing. Kudos to the Hilton.. great wheelchair accessible room and very helpful staff. We will certainly try them again!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel but not so happy....”
Reviews.Author: Debster01
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed for one night in the Hilton, just for fun and we thought we would enjoy an upscale hotel. We arrive at 1pm, knowing we are early but try to check in. Clerk at desk says rooms (we had 2) are not ready, try later. Still not ready at 3:30 and 4:40. Finally at 4:40 another person tells us we can have different rooms. We take those, but why was that option not given earlier-even the 3:30 time? The rooms were very nice-huge with comfortable beds and nice views. Huge bath too with nice toiletries. Shower door did leak underneath-kinda caused a minor flood. Anyway-very nice room. Pool and hot tub were very nice as well. We go downstairs the next morning and they have no breakfast buffet in the restaurant. They tell us the hotel is less than half full, so no buffet. Then if they are half full, then why were no rooms clean the day before??? Very frustrating. All in all a nice hotel, but I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: StacyHR
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with family for one night and it was a great experience. The location can't be beat as it is ON the Landing and by stores and restaurants. The parking in the garage is a little steep at $8 a night. Wireless is not free, $10 a day. The hotel lobby is stunning and the rooms match. Flat screen tv, updated furniture, spacious, shower AND bathtub, marble sink, fridge, large dresser. The only complaint was the water pressure in the shower was pretty low. Otherwise, a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great view room 207N”
Reviews.Author: McZuke
Reviews.Content: Great room. I had room 207N, it has a balcony with view of main square of the Landing with view of water show and the lake. Many of the rooms only have a view of the roof or parking lot or the stores in the Landing. The hotel is new, clean has covered parking and is surrounded by great restaurants. I will definitely request this room at the Hilton Promenade every time I am in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed with upgrade”
Reviews.Author: STurner21
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our wedding night before we left for Hawaii. We had originally booked a King room for one night. When we got there to check in they told us they had upgraded us to a King Condo and were giving us free valet parking - to congradulate us on our marriage! I have never been treated so kindly for no reason. This is the not the first time I have heard about the great customer service of this hotel. My husband and I talked about the great room and service the entire time we were in Maui! We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “so convenient and so nice!!”
Reviews.Author: Bob1115
Reviews.Content: Our stay got off to a rocky start with a reservation mix-up but was corrected in a 1st class professional way by Bradley who made sure we were happy and satisfied and we were!! Great stay with a beautiful comfortable room and my wife could walk out the door and shop all she desired!!! The Hilton is a GREAT way to spend time in Branson!!! Bob Fort Smith,Arkansas

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Problems, but Staff Handled Them Quickly”
Reviews.Author: Suzymittens
Reviews.Content: I was travelling to Branson alone and wanted to stay downtown and found a great deal on the Hilton website to stay for $70 (govt rate, I am a govt employee) so couldn't pass it up. They let me check in early, around 11:00 am), but must have gotten a jinxed room as I had to have people come fix stuff twice in one day! The air conditioning fan sounded like a jet engine and it couldn't be turned off so someone came and fixed it through the ceiling. Then I went to take a bath and the stopper didn't work so had to call again to replace that. You'd think that these things would have been noticed and fixed before, but, like I said, someone came and fixed both right away so really can't complain. Now for the good stuff, the room was gorgeous, the bed was fabulous, the fountain show in the evening was great and so handy to watch right outside the hotel door. The hotel is also convenient to shopping downtown and is right on the Landing so all the new stores are right there. The lakefront is beautiful and parking was handy, although you had to pay for it. I don't know if I would want to pay $200 for a room, but for $70, it was the greatest bargain in Branson. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Long term stay”
Reviews.Author: notatourist1994
Reviews.Content: Great staff, and I got to know almost all of the front office and breakfast-dining room staff. I had arrived in late April and departed in late May. Then returned in early June for 2 more weeks. One day an important package that had been sent to me but somehow didn't arrive at my room. I checked with the front desk clerk who went out of his way to track down the wayward package and personally deliver it to me. The Liberty Tavern had the best pork chop dinner I have ever had in my 62 years. The fresh string beans were out of this world excellent. The price was far below what would have been charged elsewhere in Branson if it could even be had. I hope they never loose that chef!

Reviews.Title: “You've found quality in Branson.”
Reviews.Author: fquinter
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Promenade at Branson Landing is a very nice place. This is my 16th time in going to Branson since I was 14. I am 37 now, and this whole property and mall are a nice upgrade to the Branson area. This property sits where the old Sammy Lane Resort once was. The rooms are very nice and you'll find additional space in them that you won't find in other standard room lodges. We had a queen double room with a balcony. The entry is roomy, as is the bathroom. I would say this bathroom is two to three times larger than a standard room, and the vanity is in the same room with the shower and toilet. The room itself seemed a bit crowed for four people, but something has to give since the additional space can be found in the entry and bathroom. There is a nice LCD Television and desk with a mini fridge and microwave. Our room had a sink but I don't know if it is standard. We were on the fourth floor of the south building. Our view of the mall was good but not worth paying for an upgrade to get. The air conditioner was, by my wife's standard, louder than it needed to be. I loved the hum of the unit because it drowned out other noises. There is a very nice exercise room with an indoor pool. In case you don't know, the Branson Landing Mall is the first floor, and the Hotel is located on the second through fifth floors. The mall is convenient and offers a nice overall selection of eateries, kid’s stores, ladies apparels, but minimal men’s stores. As nice as this is, it isn't perfect. The longer you would stay in this location, the less of an appeal it would bring. After my family of four went to all the stores we still found ourselves driving down the strip for other options. And, when it rains you better bring your own umbrella. As with nicer properties, there seems to be a little nickel and dimming of things. Specifically the parking. It is $12 for valet, or $8 to Self Park. They charge for phone calls. We would stay here again. But we wouldn't necessarily have loyalty to it. The strip is so entertaining and one could find quality accommodations in many places in Branson. The service was very impressive. The staff works to make your stay one of quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: bleuel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Prominade Hilton at the Landing in Branson, Mo. from 6-10 Aug. 2008. The landing is the new, place to go in Branson. The Hilton is clean, new and a great place to stay. Not much of a view from my room, but it was quiet. Great location for multiple places to eat and shop. Valet parking for $12 a day, or park yourself for $8.00 They do charge for internet use. Friendly staff and very informative. Ate at the Farm House within walking distance and it was great with good low prices. Great steak at the Texas Cattle Company and Famous Dave's at the Landing. The people in Branson were very hospital. Was kind of overwhelmed with all the shows to see. Elvis (Tony Roi) and the Jim Stafford show were the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time In Branson”
Reviews.Author: mlr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton at Branson Landing June 20th and 21st First Class, top notch. The bed was truly heavenly - slept like babies. We did the B&B pkg. I think we would not do that again - even though the food was excellent. But, 3 days in a row ??? But, the pkg. is the way to go if you don't want to venture away from your hotel for breakfast. The morning restaurant staff were a bit LESS than friendly - not sure why - could be they didn't get their morning coffee - but, their almost surly attitude did detract from our otherwise pleasant time in Branson and at the Landing. (There were more than one less than friendly person there - EACH morning their disposition was the same and we ate there 3 mornings.) So, maybe there is something else going on there. They seemed almost contescending. (and no, we are not troublemakers or complainers). It is a nice hotel - but the service staff at The Chateau were far and above more friendly to their guests. Even though our room was right across the street fromt he Irish Pub and it was very noisy at night - GREAT show, by the way - the soundproofing was excellent and it did not disturb our sleep. We were on the 3rd floor. Lower floor could pose a problem with noise. Not the cheapest sleep in Branson, but surely one of the classiest. No qualms at all about recommending this hotel - but maybe eat breakfast elsewhere?

Reviews.Title: “Less than expected for the price”
Reviews.Author: nightowlmom
Reviews.Content: We were excited to be staying at an upscale hotel in Branson. This is one of the pricier options for the area and we wanted a nice place this time with a great pool. Well, the pool was very nice, clean and open late. However, the room had some major issues, primarily that the air conditioning system was extremely noisy. When it started blowing it sounded like a jet engine taking off and then whistled through the vents, terrible! The water pressure was terrible as well. The room was beautiful with great beds and a very nice balcony. My problem with this hotel also was the $8 for self parking and $9.95 per day for internet. For $209 a night, that should be included. On Friday night after arriving back at the hotel after a show there was no parking. We had to park in a public garage and request the $8 be subtracted from our bill. The Branson Landing area is very nice and a fun place to be but not worth the price of the hotel. We probably won't stay here again. Want to mention that the front desk people were extremely polite and our issues are more with the corporate policies of parking/internet by Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: ohhemi
Reviews.Content: Hi everyone! We stayed at the Hilton Promenade to celebrate our 19th wedding Anniversary. We did not know the treat that was behind the door! As soon as we walked into the entrance way. Everything was balance with earth tones and deep rich reds. It was well equipped with a full size kitchen that held a dishwasher, a fully stocked cabinet for cooking and dining. Full size Refrigerator and freezer with ice maker. The living room had a flat screen plasma neatly placed to blend in with the fine furnishings. The kitchen and living was a beautiful black marble and gold flaked breakfast bar including 3 tall leather wooden chairs with red leather seats. Talk about style. The Hilton did an amazing job of decorating. A beautiful balcony waited exiting the living room, or master bedroom. Super nice patio set with 2 swivel rocking chairs that matched the 2 accent chairs. Glass table with a view of the entire Branson landing shopping. The amazing stores below drew in huge crowds. It was a simple pleasers just to sit and relax while people watching all the interesting people walking below. Retiring back into the condo to explore more. In the master bedroom, equipped with a nice French door closet with iron and another flat screen plasma television, a red high back accent chair and 3 wooden dressers and night stands. Plenty of storage room! The bathroom was HUGE! It had 2 entry doors, a gigantic glass shower with at least 6 feet of space to roam. A 2 person Jacuzzi, a double sink with marble counter tops. Everything in beautiful neutral earth tones. Including a wide variety of fully stocked towels, washcloth’s, and hand towels. I LOVE Jacuzzis and this one had so many jets that it relaxed every ache and muscle pain away! Did I mention it had a full size washer and dryer!! I have a pet peeve of taking home dirty clothes in nice luggage! The Hilton Promenade was more then I could dream of, we have been coast to coast and this hotel was a vacation in itself! Next time I will not book any shows, because I did not want to leave my room! But we did take in the Chinese acrobats. It was a very cool show, amazing stunts performed and it was 2 hours long. So I couldn’t wait to return to my room to lie on the feather bed. Ohhhhh and the lush feather pillows! I normally like hard and stiff beds. But this bed was like sleeping on a cloud!

Reviews.Title: “Treated Like Royalty”
Reviews.Author: trea4luck
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hilton Branson Landing and LOVED IT....very nice hotel and the staff were amazing... We slept well in the beds and the location above the shopping is perfect. NO COMPLAINTS!! The Hilton is the place to stay without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: karenpStLouis
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I stayed here overnight for a Mothers day getaway. It is is beautiful hotel. Very large room, wonderful bathroom with separate shower. I think the price is steep, but I was using a gift certificate, so it was basically covered. The location is wonderful on the Landing, able to just walk to eat, drink, and shop. I do think to charge for hotel parking in Branson is a little ridiculous, though. I would only stay again if I got a good deal, or if it was for a special occasion. For the price, I think I would be more apt to try the Best Western located a few blocks up and still within walking distance of the landing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Gina144
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised at a GREAT weekend. Check in was OK, got an excellent room. We were expecting a regular hotel room and ended up in a room as big if not bigger than some apartments. We had a living room, bar, full kitchen, bedroom, flat screen TV's in living and bedroom and a huge bathroom with walk in shower, whirlpool tub and 2 sink vanity. There was also a washer and dryer.....amazing....and better yet, a balcony with table and 4 comfortable chairs that was covered, sliding door from bedroom or door from living room. Living room and large windows also. So, the room was great and the location was wonderful. We met my parents for Mothers day and the "Landing" was great. Many great shops, restaurants, you could just mosey along and there was something for everyone. The lake view was great, you could walk along the lake...we ended up skipping the strip and spending the weekend there. There are boat tours to go on, and a great fountain/fire show to music every 30 minutes in the afternoons and evenings.There is a short trolley that is free and will take you in to old Branson where there are old time diners and gift shops. You can get off and back on with little worry as they cycle through quickly. We can say that we think they have planned this area to a "T" and had a very enjoyable stay. Hotel service was without a hitch......all staff were pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, Super friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: pvel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family. We were attending a conference at the Convention Center Hilton, but chose to stay here because of the water and fire show. We requested a room with a view of the water show at the time of booking and that request was put in. However our room, while it did have a view of the lake and water show, did not have a full frontal view. I called the front desk and they relocated me to a room with a great view. The water show is really nice and my young daughter loved it. It is spectacular, like at the Bellagio in Las Vegas. Mostly we liked the comfort, like having a refrigerator and microwave in the rooms and the friendly service. EVERY single staff person we came into contact with was super friendly and genuinely helpful. No bad attitudes anywhere, which can really ruin a stay for me. More consistently cheerful and helpful people than any other hotel I have used. And I do travel regularly. There is a pretty nice mall nearby and no shortage of good places to eat in all price ranges. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: smcraig
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on our way from Indiana to New Mexico. We were married in July of last year but were unable to have a honeymoon at the same time because he was still in Tech School for the Air Force. On our move down to our first stationed base we stopped in Branson for a two day honeymoon and stayed in the Hilton. It was amazing. The hotel was apart of a small "downtown" type shopping area on the river. Just feet from the exit was a beautiful water and light show at night and wonderful restaurants. If you like the night life, it has that too. Not to mention it is right near all of the Branson attractions, from dinner shows to museums to a great winery that my husband and enjoyed. We will definitely be returning to the Landing. We would suggest and recommend this site for anyone!

Reviews.Title: “will stay elsewhere next time”
Reviews.Author: Love-to-Travel-501
Reviews.Content: I am writing this as I set in the hotel itself. After reading the other reviews we chose this hotel and it was a mistake.We had none of the good service that was mentioned in other reviews. We got in our room and found the toilet had not been cleaned this is upon check-in not our mess. My hubby called the front desk and asked for it to be cleaned and we went out and when we returned 4 hours later it took 2 more calls before someone come and cleaned it. The pool is small but that had been mentioned so was expected but was not ready for how cold the water was. It did not feel the least bit heated. I am very very disappointed with this hotel and I will complain when I check out in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great honeymoon at the Hilton Promenade!”
Reviews.Author: TXKBaby
Reviews.Content: Our honeymoon was wonderful from beginning to end... The hotel was perfect-- trendy and new. It was in a fabulous location, right in the middle of the Branson Landing, giving us a fantastic view of the fountains and shopping. The hotel staff was friendly. As soon as we checked in, we received a fruit & cheese basket because it was our honeymoon. Everyone was super nice. I just can't say enough about our experience. We will definitely go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Branson Landing Hilton a wonderful Branson addition”
Reviews.Author: KUKatie
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with a great location if you do not wish to be right smack in the middle of Branson. It has beautiful surroundings in the heart of the Branson Landing shoppin area, surrouned by water and trees. The rooms are plush and spacious with all of the latest amenities including flat screen TV's, large marble bathrooms with seperate shower and tub, and great rooms with view. The beds were heavenly and very comfortable. This hotel sold me on the Hilton brand of hotels. The staff was wonderful and tried very hard to get to know you by name. The resturant on site was a little spendy but the food was wonderful. The common areas were open and beautiful. The maid service was prompt in the mornings. My only compliants about the hotel was that it was loud in the evenings due to some of the bars and street performers right outside of the hotel and the price of the food. Also it was hard to reach the concierge for assistance in booking attractions. Overall our stay here was most enjoyable and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to this area as a gem of a hotel. I know the next time we are in the area this will be our first choice in hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tess38
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4 night stay at the Hilton Promenade in Branson. The place was wonderful. I took my mom for a gospel convention there and we had a great time. I will tell you that I booked the stay with Hilton Club "points" so our stay was free (for the most part) Sometimes you do not get great service though when you are staying "free" so I didn't know what to expect. From the minute we arrived, the service was fantastic. The poor guy that unloaded my luggage and carted it up to the room was so friendly (my mom and I do NOT travel lite) and he put everything away and showed us where everything was and made sure we were happy before he left. The room was wonderful and very clean. The beds were comfortable and they give you plenty of pillows. I like that! We had room service several times and it was really good. They brought it very fast too. The employees were ALL very nice. We used the valet service and it was great as well. Everytime I needed my car, it was waiting when we got down to the lobby. I definately would stay here again, and I highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Facility and Location, but ask for a room in a Quiet area!”
Reviews.Author: smonti
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend stay at the Hilton Promenade @ Branson Landing. Pros: Location - Couldn't be better. Right in the middle of the Landing. From hotel, walk or ride free trolley to restaurants, bars and shopping. Accross the street from the convention center. Room & Ameneties - Rooms are luxurious. Contemporary furnishings. Hot Tub / Pool / Workout Center - great. Onsite restaurant - Liberty Tavern - great food. Cons: Noise - We were in room N201. It was directly above Liberty Tavern and across the street from Waxy O'Sheas. It was Saturday night and people were having fun! Very loud until the bars closed. Ask for a room in a quiet area. No shower - I kid you not. We were already unpacked and settled in before we noticed. Big beautiful bathroom with jacuzzi tub, but no shower. Very odd.. I will go back - but will request a QUIET room with a SHOWER!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: annemarie1983
Reviews.Content: This place is terrific!! It's right downtown and on the new Branson Landing right behind the fountain. Since it's right in the middle of the landing, it's within walking distance of everything from Belk on one end to Bass Pro on the other. The employees were all very helpful and friendly and the rooms were very nice. The showers are separate from the tubs which made the bathrooms larger. Will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: cyewren
Reviews.Content: We've just gotten back from staying at the Hilton Promenade (Branson Landing) for the last week. Eager to start our honeymoon our very first interaction with the Hilton set the stage for an unforgettable experience. As we pulled up to Valet (after having read the previous reviews about parking on the landing, we knew to skip straight to valet) the Valet met us at the car with sincere warm congratulations then walked us to the front desk where they greeted us by name unexpectedly. Like others here we too received a free upgrade to a condo. Bonus for us the condo was directly across from the gorgeous Christmas tree in the Square. Prior to our Arrival the Hilton had called my parents to tell us of the 59th annual "Adoration" Christmas parade. They let us know what time it started and let us know exactly where to watch it from when we got there. The first night of our stay we were surprised with a tray of chocolate covered strawberries and oranges and two bottles of sparkling wine, along with congratulations from the staff. Our entire stay was full of amazing service, a warm attentive staff and a romance that made our honeymoon perfect. Warm terry cloth bath robes, a large jacuzzi, and bedding that is out of this world makes for a sweet honeymoon atmosphere as well! The only thing that could have made our stay better was a cheaper alternative to the parking situation. On the other hand then we wouldn't have met the wonderful valet guys, who also remembered us by name every time, and had lots of helpful hints on things from shows to the best place to freeze our butts off fishing! We'll most certainly be back for our 1 year anniversary and cannot wait to enjoy the Hilton again!

Reviews.Title: “Chic and convenient”
Reviews.Author: mrsgaston
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently decided to take a very mini vacation to Branson, Mo. We live only 2 hours away, but wanted to get away for relaxation. We only had one evening so we wanted a convenient place to stay that was close to shopping and food. We chose the new Hilton directly at the Branson Landing. It was a little expensive, but well worth it. The lobby was beautifully decorated for Christmas and the front desk workers were incredibly welcoming. Our room was very chic and stylish which helped us feel like we were on a far off getaway. We overlooked the fountain at the Landing and were directly at our shopping and eating destination. We look forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BI-Travelers
Reviews.Content: I booked a girls' weekend getaway at the Hilton Promenade based on the positive reviews I read on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. We had a room on the fifth floor with a balcony facing the shops. The decor was modern, the room was a nice size and the bathroom was exceptionally large. It was nice to be able to walk down to the restaurants and stores, and the shows were only a short drive away. We were quite impressed with the hourly fountain shows, although I think they need to include a variety of music rather than the same ones over and over. The staff at the hotel was quite accommodating. We booked a room rate that included breakfast in the hotel restaurant, The Liberty Tavern, and if you are breakfast eaters this is definitely the way to go. If you like Mexican food, be sure to eat at Cantina Laredo which is located at the Landing. They make guacamole at your table and it is delicious. We also enjoyed Piztro also located at the Landing. As far as shows, we saw Paul Revere & the Raiders with Bill Medley and it was excellent. We also saw the Broadway Star Spangled Celebration and enjoyed it very much as well.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Branson”
Reviews.Author: GCDallas
Reviews.Content: Very easy to get to. Location is fabulous. No hassle check-in and out. Clean. Fountain view is a must, large sized balcony, room and bathroom. Flat screen TV. Modern furniture. Very helpful concierge. Gym was ok. Restaurant food was fair. A two minute drive to the start of the strip. This hotel made our visit to Branson better. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: McKinney_TXHanger
Reviews.Content: This is a brand new hotel. The location in Branson is great. We stayed in room 519 and it faces the mall and a nightly water show. The hotel is very well kept and very clean due to its brand new. The price is very good for a hilton hotel. If you are going to Branson, stay here and ask for a room facing the water show.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Branson”
Reviews.Author: Mskay
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights, was a nice new property, but nothing really impressed me all that much about it. We avoided the strip, only drove down it once just to see what has changed over the years (not much). There is a Bass Pro Shop, Belk Dept.store, shops like Yankee Candle and JJill in the shopping area. Lots of variety as far as restaurants there. We were right across from the train depot, so you could hear trains late at night, and that may bother some people, but I love to hear it. I probably would not stay here again, only because there are so many other places to try. Would be great for a girlfriend weekend. I hated the $8.00 per day parking garage fee. Such is life.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, good way to avoid the dreaded 'Strip' traffic”
Reviews.Author: Mega_Man_KC
Reviews.Content: I love Branson, but I don't like all the traffic along the "Strip", and I like getting out on the lakes so this locationis perfect for that. You can get on Lake Taneycomo, but be aware you can't swim on this lake, you have to go to Table Rock for that. The Landing is a nice little shopping dining area that surrounds the hotel. The hotel was in excellent shape, brand new, great design, nice decoration. The room was excellent, flat panel TV, separate shower and bath, great bed. There was a hand written note waiting on our bed thanking us for visiting (I've been to places where we were very unwelcome). We only had two problems, making sure we had our included breakfast vouchers (taken care of quickly and with a smile by management) and the parking lot being full (but free valet was provided in this instance). Liberty Tavern has a great value breakfast if you buy it when making a reservation and I had a great dinner there too. Staying here is a no-miss, win-win situation for those avoiding the "Strip". The only problem is that it is far from the shows and amusement parks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: MizMolly
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel! We booked a King Deluxe room online. Upon arrival we asked for a room with a view. We were pleasantly surprised to enter our room and find that they upgraded us to a one bedroom (King) condo with a balcony, at no additional charge! The king bed was heavenly. The kitchen had stainless steel appliances. The kitchen and living room floors are hardwood, the bathroom has tile and soft carpet in the bedroom. I loved the huge bathroom with double sinks, a jacuzzi tub and big walk in shower. There is a flat screen tv in the living room as well as a wall-mounted flat screen tv in the bedroom. there are sliding doors from the bedroom to the balcony. I have posted some pictures we took. The best part is the location. We walked to dinner and lunch. Highly recommend Pizstro, absolutely great pizzas and panini sandwiches. They have a daquiri bar that is yummy! Joe's Crab Shack within walking distance too. Awesome crab dip and great margaritas!

Reviews.Title: “It was nice”
Reviews.Author: FergieLuck
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice! The rooms were large and comfortable. I liked the bedding. The lighting in the bathroom was really bad. No way a woman can put on make-up. Also, not enough towel racks or shower caddy's. The shower head is not good either. Asked for more towels but never go them. HOWEVER, the flat screens were nice, the fridge w/ icemaker was great, the balcony was nice. I thought the price was somewhat high. But, I'd recommend it to others and would stay there again if I could get a better rate.

HotelInfo.Name: Hilton Promenade at Branson Landing
HotelInfo.Address: 3 Branson Landing, Branson, MO 65616
